text:
ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡ª Uku Suviste to represent Estonia at the 2021 Eurovision Song Contest
Tonight, Estonia held the final of Eesti Laul, in order to select their Eurovision 2021 representative. After a spectacular show, it was revealed that Uku Suviste has once again won the ticket to represent Estonia at the Eurovision Song Contest.
12 acts fought for the Estonian ticket for Eurovision
After two semi-finals last month, 24 acts became 12, and then 12 became one. The competing acts tonight are as follows:
Egert Milder â€“ Free Again Suured tÃ¼drukud â€“ Heavenâ€™s Not That Far Tonight Hans Nayna â€“ One By One Ivo Linna, Robert Linna, Supernova -Ma olen siin Karl Killing â€“ Kiss Me Uku Suviste â€“ The Lucky One Sissi â€“ Time JÃ¼ri Pootsmann â€“ Magnus melanhoolia Redel â€“ Tartu Koit Toome â€“ We Could Have Been Beautiful Andrei Zevakin & Pluuto â€“ Wingman Kadri Voorand â€“ Energy
Estonia in the Eurovision Song Contest
The Baltic country made their Eurovision debut in 1994 with Silvi Vrait and her song â€˜Nagu merelaineâ€™. Since then, Estonia has participated at the Eurovision Song Contest 25 times, and has made it to the final 16 times.
Last yearÂ Estonia selected Uku SuvisteÂ to represent them at theÂ Eurovision Song Contest 2020, with his song â€˜What Love Isâ€™. Which was written by Uku with Sharon Vaughn and produced by Dimitris Kontopoulos. Unfortunately, theÂ contest was cancelledÂ due to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, this year ERR gave himÂ direct selection to the Semi-Finals.
